body: Thanks for the report. Will investigate further early next week when I'm back from vacation.

I've fixed this - here is a beta with the fix in.

http://pub.rclone.org/v1.33-5-gb3d0848%CE%B2/

Please re-open the ticket if you find a problem with it.

I'm having this same issue with rclone v1.36, using Backblaze B2 underneath a crypt remote:

```
2017/06/04 15:59:51 ERROR : example.txt: Failed to copy: object corrupted on transfer - SHA1 mismatch (want "" got "b9ada2021a634f251fa3ee2b356f770efc99c236")
```

It looks like @NewtsLament saw `"none"` as the wanted hash, whereas I'm currently seeing `""`.
@ivy I fixed this again in 1d42a343d25b4ae6263fe2046c681f54ebee53dc - if you try the latest beta you should find it works fine.

Still getting this issue on the most recent 1.37 beta release:

`# rclone move --verbose b2:xtcrbackup/webserver/ b2:oasiscraft-backup/`

```
2017/08/16 05:42:04 ERROR : 2017-03-25/accounts/dragonet.tar.gz: Failed to copy: object corrupted on transfer - SHA1 mismatch (want "" got "99e376f1ffbb4154924cb982382bdcd00451989b")
2017/08/16 05:42:04 ERROR : 2017-03-25/accounts/dragonet.tar.gz: Not deleting source as copy failed: object corrupted on transfer - SHA1 mismatch (want "" got "99e376f1ffbb4154924cb982382bdcd00451989b")

```
```
# rclone --version
rclone v1.37-093-gb510c70cß
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.8.3
```

@phillmac can you reproduce this reliably? How big are the files you are transferring?

If so can you paste a log with `-vv` please?

@phillmac I think I've found the problem - can you have a go with this please?

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.37-115-g8207af94/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

@ncw Sorry for the late reply, just tested it and the issue seems to be
resolved.

On Fri, Sep 1, 2017 at 6:43 AM, Nick Craig-Wood <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @phillmac <https://github.com/phillmac> I think I've found the problem -
> can you have a go with this please?
>
> https://beta.rclone.org/v1.37-115-g8207af94/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

@Archerious can you make sure you are using a recent rclone ( [the latest release](https://rclone.org/downloads/)) and if you can still reproduce it then please make a [new issue on github](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/new/choose) with full instructions on how to reproduce - thanks!
Will do, as the issue is back :(.
